item.title: 英国将重新发放 3750 英镑补助金支持购买部分电动汽车
item.description: 英国工党政府正在重新推出高达 3,750 英镑（5,000 美元）的补助金，以支持电动汽车的购买，以支持其陷入困境的汽车行业，并实现净零排放目标。【原文：The UK is reintroducing grants of as much as £3,750 ($5,000) to support electric vehicle purchases, as the Labour government seeks to bolster its beleaguered auto industry and meet net zero goals.】

item.title: 简-方达警告气候和民主都面临危机
item.description:
在彭博绿色西雅图会议上，这位女演员说，现在是 "机不可失，时不再来 "的时刻，既要减少排放，又要恢复民主规范。【原文：

Speaking at Bloomberg Green Seattle, the actress said it’s a “now or never” moment to both cut emissions and restore democratic norms.

】

item.title: 新西兰农民抨击拟议的绿色金融规则
item.description: 新西兰农民抨击了拟议中的绿色金融规则，警告说这些规则行不通，并有可能因推高成本而损害农村社区。【原文：New Zealand farmers have attacked proposed rules for green finance, warning they are unworkable and risk harming rural communities by driving up costs.】

item.title: 野村亚洲绿色科技主管乔德里据说将离职
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，野村控股公司（Nomura Holdings Inc.【原文：Nomura Holdings Inc.’s head of greentech industrials and infrastructure dealmaking in Asia ex-Japan Anoop Chaudhry has left the Japanese lender, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 康菲石油公司寻求扩大阿拉斯加北极地区的石油勘探范围
item.description: 康菲石油公司（ConocoPhillips）正推动在阿拉斯加的巨型柳树项目附近勘探更多的石油，该公司认为阿拉斯加北部的北极地区蕴藏着大量未被发现的原油。【原文：ConocoPhillips is pushing to explore for more oil near its mammoth Willow project in Alaska, betting there are vast reserves of undiscovered crude in the state’s Arctic north.】

item.title: 纽约、新泽西州周一晚面临洪水暴雨
item.description: 暴雨威胁着纽约市周边地区的洪水，随着缓慢移动的雷暴在三州地区晃动，暴雨可能还会持续几个小时。【原文：Torrential downpours are threatening flooding around New York City and will likely last a few more hours as slow-moving thunderstorms wobble through the Tri-State Area.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州为何如此易受气候灾害影响
item.description:
随着人口的增长和气候变化导致更多极端天气事件的发生，该州很可能在未来几十年内遭受更多损失。【原文：

As its population grows and climate change causes more extreme weather events, the state is likely to suffer more losses in the coming decades.

】

item.title: 干燥天气持续，英国农民面临更大火灾风险
item.description: 在长时间的炎热干燥天气之后，英国农民的田地和收割机都面临着更大的火灾风险。【原文：British farmers are facing increased fire risks to both their fields and harvesting machines, following a long spell of hot, dry weather.】

item.title: 电力游说团体称印度放宽污染标准有利于消费者
item.description: 印度电力生产商协会称，印度放宽发电厂二氧化硫排放标准将有利于消费者，避免因设备成本增加而导致电价上涨。【原文：India’s relaxed norms on sulfur dioxide emissions from power plants will favor consumers, avoiding higher electricity prices due to increased equipment costs, according to the Association of Power Producers.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司因天气干旱限制用水
item.description: 泰晤士水务公司（Thames Water）要求英国部分地区的用户在长期炎热干燥的天气中限制用水。【原文：Thames Water has asked customers in parts of the UK to limit water use amid a prolonged period of hot, dry weather.】

item.title: 亚马逊领导人将有关黄金交易的黑暗信息带到伦敦
item.description: 上周，一个亚马逊领导人代表团从世界上最大的热带雨林来到伦敦金融中心，传达了一个信息：资本主义辜负了他们的家园及其居民。【原文：A delegation of Amazonian leaders journeyed from the world’s largest rainforest to the financial center of London last week to deliver a message: capitalism has failed their home and its inhabitants.】

item.title: 特朗普税法为无人问津的能源和气候部门提供了救命稻草
item.description:

From coal-fired power to a risky bet to cool the planet, these are the sectors likely to get a boost.

item.title: 美国加征关税在即，欧盟官员称集团将探索亚洲契约
item.description: 一位高级官员表示，欧盟正在寻求深化与印度和亚太地区其他国家的贸易协定，因为欧盟正在为美国加征关税做准备。【原文：The European Union is looking to deepen trade agreements with India and other countries in the Asia-Pacific region as the bloc braces for US tariffs, a top official said.】

item.title: 一夜之间，新的洪水暴雨在受灾严重的得克萨斯州蔓延开来
item.description: 德克萨斯州中部、康乔河谷和希尔县的河流在又一夜的暴雨引发山洪暴发后水位不断上涨，而这距离该地区遭受 7 月 4 日的洪灾仅一周多的时间，这次洪灾造成至少 120 人死亡，更多人失踪。【原文：Rivers across central Texas, the Concho Valley and Hill County are rising after another night of heavy rain touched off flash floods, just over a week after the area was devastated by a July 4 deluge that killed at least 120 people and left many more missing.】

item.title: 英国迎来夏季第三次热浪，气温将达到峰值
item.description: 预报员说，今夏第三次热浪将在周六达到顶峰，英国部分地区的最高气温可能超过 34 摄氏度。【原文：The third heatwave of the summer is set to peak on Saturday, forecasters said, with highs of more than 34C possible in parts of the UK.】

item.title: 通用电气弗诺瓦公司为损坏的风叶向南塔基特岛赔偿 1050 万美元
item.description: 去年，通用电气弗诺瓦公司（GE Vernova）的一个海上风力涡轮机叶片碎裂并被冲上岸，该公司将向南塔基特岛社区支付 1050 万美元。【原文：GE Vernova will pay $10.5 million to the island community of Nantucket after one of its offshore wind turbine blades broke into pieces and washed ashore last year.】

item.description: 我们的 "酷热周 "报道仍在继续，今天的时事通讯将从科学角度探讨世界究竟会变得有多热。您还可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享全文。【原文：As our Heat Week coverage continues, today’s newsletter looks at how hot the world can actually get, scientifically speaking. You can also read and share the full story on Bloomberg.com.】

】

item.title: 汇丰银行退出被华尔街抛弃的银行气候联盟
item.description: 汇丰控股公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）退出了全球最大的银行气候联盟，在过去八个月里，美国最大的贷款机构纷纷出走，使该联盟备受冲击。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc has left the world’s biggest climate alliance for banks, which was rocked over the past eight months by an exodus of the biggest US lenders.】

item.title: 特斯拉可能从八月起在印度开始首批交付
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，特斯拉公司将于本周二在印度开设第一家展厅，最早将于下个月开始交付产品，这家由埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）领导的电动汽车制造商希望挖掘印度这个第三大汽车市场的潜在需求，以应对其他地区销售放缓的局面。【原文：Tesla Inc. will open its first showroom in India on Tuesday and begin deliveries as early as next month, according to people familiar with the matter, as the Elon Musk-led electric vehicle maker looks to tap potential demand in the third-largest automobile market to counter slowing sales elsewhere.】

item.title: 西班牙、希腊天气警报持续，欧洲陷入炎热之中
item.description: 炎热、晴朗的天气正在欧洲大部分地区蔓延，下周西班牙部分地区将出现更极端的气温。【原文：Hot, sunny weather is spreading across most of Europe with more extreme temperatures due next week in parts of Spain.】

item.title: 欧洲央行将 "务实 "监管银行的碳过渡计划
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）表示，在贷款机构准备法律规定的如何向低碳经济过渡的计划时，不会立即对其提出严格要求。【原文：The European Central Bank signaled that it won’t immediately hold lenders to strict demands as they prepare legally-mandated plans for how they will accompany the move to a low carbon-economy.】

item.title: 研究发现：审计师未能发挥保护碳市场的作用
item.description: 新的学术研究表明，审计师作为碳抵消质量的第三方保证人，其作用正在失效。【原文：Auditors are failing in their role as third-party guarantors of the quality of carbon offsets, according to new academic research.】

item.title: 美国有望在 2026 年批准田纳西河流域管理局核反应堆项目
item.description: 随着电力需求的激增，核管理委员会预计将在 2026 年底前批准田纳西流域管理局建造一座小型核反应堆的计划。【原文：The Nuclear Regulatory Commission expects to approve by the end of 2026 Tennessee Valley Authority’s plan to build a small nuclear reactor, as demand for electricity surges.】

item.title: 特朗普第二任期头几个月油气管道安全案件骤降
item.description: 随着唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）推动精简政府和削减繁文缛节，美国为确保石油和天然气管道安全而采取的监管行动骤降至总统任期伊始的新低。【原文：US regulatory actions to ensure oil and gas pipeline safety have plummeted to a record low for the start of a presidential administration as Donald Trump pushes to streamline the government and cut red tape.】

item.title: 外国公司比以往任何时候都更主导美国 ESG 市场
item.description: 今年，外国公司比以往任何时候都更热衷于在美国市场上发行可持续债券，因为政治反弹和微不足道的定价优势继续让美国公司保持观望。【原文：The US market for sustainable bonds is being crowded by foreign companies this year more than ever, as political backlash and negligible pricing benefits continue to keep American companies on the sidelines.】

item.title: 波士顿电池制造商迁至芝加哥，普利兹克获胜
item.description: 电池制造商 Pure Lithium Corp. 将把业务从波士顿迁至芝加哥，伊利诺伊州州长 JB Pritzker 又一次赢得了胜利。【原文：Battery manufacturer Pure Lithium Corp. will move its operations to Chicago from Boston, handing Illinois Governor JB Pritzker another win.】

item.description:
